page.title: 18THE HERMITAGE,CATON
page.content: The Hermitage old people's home is situated near the Crook OÂ£Lune.It is almost surrounded by trees.Near it is the Lancaster to Wennington railway, which is now converted into a footpath. The Hermitage was built in 1849 by a lawyer called John Sharpe as a private mansion.Just before the war it was changed into a hotel.The largest bedroom in the house was once a cafe in the hotel and what is now the dining room was a ballroom.Not many people had cars to come to the hotel,so the hotel was changed into an old folks'home.The house has 10 bedrooms,3 lounges,1 kitchen and numerous other rooms.The grounds have an area of 2 acres and sometimes the residents are taken to the Crook OÂ£Lune.There are 39 staff and 29 residents.There is supposed to be a ghost called The Little Old Lady In Grey on the first floor.
